question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

Which one of the following could be the schedule of the students' reports?
A) Mon. morning: Helen; Mon. afternoon: Robert Tues. morning: Olivia; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Lenore; Wed. afternoon: Kyle
B) Mon. morning: Irving; Mon. afternoon: Olivia Tues. morning: Helen; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Nina; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
C) Mon. morning: Lenore; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: George; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Robert; Wed. afternoon: Irving
D) Mon. morning: Nina; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: Robert; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Olivia; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
E) Mon. morning: Olivia; Mon. afternoon: Nina Tues. morning: Irving; Tues. afternoon: Helen Wed. morning: Kyle; Wed. afternoon: George
chain_of_thought: We know that George can only give a report on Tuesday, and neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports.  We need to find a schedule that satisfies all of these conditions.
full_output:
<think>We know that George can only give a report on Tuesday, and neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports.  We need to find a schedule that satisfies all of these conditions.</think>
<ans>B</ans>

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

If Kyle and Lenore do not give reports, then the morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, respectively, could be given by
A) Helen, George, and Nina
B) Irving, Robert, and Helen
C) Nina, Helen, and Olivia
D) Olivia, Robert, and Irving
E) Robert, George, and Helen
chain_of_thought: We know the following: Tuesday is the only day George can give a report, Olivia and Robert cannot give an afternoon report, and Nina's report will cause Helen and Irving to give reports on the next day if Nina is on the same day.  If Kyle and Lenore don't give reports, the morning reports will be given by Helen, George, and Nina.  So, the answer must be A.
full_output:
<think>We know the following: Tuesday is the only day George can give a report, Olivia and Robert cannot give an afternoon report, and Nina's report will cause Helen and Irving to give reports on the next day if Nina is on the same day.  If Kyle and Lenore don't give reports, the morning reports will be given by Helen, George, and Nina.  So, the answer must be A.</think>
<ans>A</ans>

Which one of the following is a pair of students who, if they give reports on the same day as each other, must give reports on Wednesday?
A) George and Lenore
B) Helen and Nina
C) Irving and Robert
D) Kyle and Nina
E) Olivia and Kyle
chain_of_thought: Nina giving a report means that on the next day, Helen and Irving must give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

<think>Nina giving a report means that on the next day, Helen and Irving must give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.</think>
<ans>B</ans>

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

If George, Nina, and Robert give reports and they do so on different days from one another, which one of the following could be true?
A) Helen gives a report on Wednesday.
B) Nina gives a report on Monday.
C) Nina gives a report on Tuesday.
D) Olivia gives a report on Monday.
E) Robert gives a report on Wednesday.
chain_of_thought: George gives a report on Tuesday. Nina and Robert cannot give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports. Nina gives a report on Monday, so Helen and Irving must give reports on Tuesday. So Nina gives a report on Monday, and the other reports must be given by George and Robert on Tuesday and Wednesday.
full_output:
<think>George gives a report on Tuesday. Nina and Robert cannot give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports. Nina gives a report on Monday, so Helen and Irving must give reports on Tuesday. So Nina gives a report on Monday, and the other reports must be given by George and Robert on Tuesday and Wednesday. </think>
<ans>C</ans>

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

If Kyle gives the afternoon report on Tuesday, and Helen gives the afternoon report on Wednesday, which one of the following could be the list of the students who give the morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, respectively?
A) Irving, Lenore, and Nina
B) Lenore, George, and Irving
C) Nina, Irving, and Lenore
D) Robert, George, and Irving
E) Robert, Irving, and Lenore
chain_of_thought: George can only give a report on Tuesday, and Nina’s report triggers Helen and Irving to give reports. We know that Olivia and Robert can’t give afternoon reports. If Kyle gives the afternoon report on Tuesday, then Helen gives the afternoon report on Wednesday.  Nina can give a report on Monday or Tuesday, and if she does, then Irving and Helen will give reports on the next day.
full_output:
<think>George can only give a report on Tuesday, and Nina’s report triggers Helen and Irving to give reports. We know that Olivia and Robert can’t give afternoon reports. If Kyle gives the afternoon report on Tuesday, then Helen gives the afternoon report on Wednesday.  Nina can give a report on Monday or Tuesday, and if she does, then Irving and Helen will give reports on the next day.</think>
<ans>C</ans>
